#summary Some additional information on Joe-E.

= Introduction to Joe-E =

Our [http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~daw/joe-e/nsf-poster.pdf poster]
provides a brief overview to Joe-E


= Joe-E Language Specification =

The [http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~daw/joe-e/spec-20080203.pdf latest draft of the language spec] is from Feb. 3, 2008.

= Introduction to Object Capabilities =

Joe-E is an object-capability system.  Want some background on object-capability systems?  A short [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object-capability_model overview of the object-capability model] is available on Wikipedia.  Don't miss Ben Laurie's [http://www.links.org/files/capabilities.pdf introduction to capabilities]. For another overview of some work in this area, you can watch [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EGX2I31OhBE a survey talk] by David Wagner, or read [http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~daw/talks/TRUST07.pdf his annotated slides].  The [http://www.eros-os.org/mailman/listinfo/cap-talk cap-talk mailing list] is a good place to discuss the object-capability model, and the 
[http://www.eros-os.org/mailman/listinfo/e-lang e-lang mailing list] is a good place to discuss language-based approaches to object-capabilities (such as Joe-E).

= Historical Information =

Older versions of the specifications, code, and other interest of solely
